citation.article-title: Selective isolation and characterisation of members of the Streptomyces violaceusniger clade associated with the roots of Paraserianthes falcataria.

p.s: Description of Streptomyces rhizosphaerius sp. nov.
Streptomyces rhizosphaerius (rhi.zo.sphae'ri.us. Gr.n. rhiza, root; Gr. n. sphaera, sphere; N.L. masc. adj. rhizosphaerius belonging to the sphere of the root)
Spore chains are Spirales; the spore surface is rugose.
On oatmeal agar the spore mass is gray, the substrate mycelium grayish-yellow and the diffusible pigment yellow.
The strain degrades adenine and pectin and grows at 10 Â°C; other phenotypic properties are shown in Table 4.
The strain was isolated from the rhizosphere of the tropical legume, Paraserianthes falcataria.
The type strain is A10P1 (= DSM 41760 = NCIMB 13674).
